item.title: Bradley add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Over the centuries, mankind has tried many ways of combating the forces of evil... prayer, fasting, good works and so on. Up until Doom, no one seemed to have thought about the double-barrel shotgun. Eat leaden death, demon..." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Someone told me the delightful story of the crusader who put a chastity belt on his wife and gave the key to his best friend for safekeeping, in case of his death. He had ridden only a few miles away when his friend, riding hard, caught up with him, saying 'You gave me the wrong key!" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Marquis de Sade
item.description: "We are no guiltier in following the primative impulses that govern us than is the Nile for her floods or the sea for her waves." -- Marquis de Sade

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them. In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "The total amount of suffering per year in the natural world is beyond all decent contemplation. During the minute that it takes me to compose this sentence, thousands of animals are being eaten alive, many others are running for their lives, whimpering with fear, others are slowly being devoured from within by rasping parasites, thousands of all kinds are dying of starvation, thirst, and disease. It must be so. If there ever is a time of plenty, this very fact will automatically lead to an increase in the population until the natural state of starvation and misery is restored. In a universe of electrons and selfish genes, blind physical forces and genetic replication, some people are going to get hurt, other people are going to get lucky, and you won't find any rhyme or reason in it, nor any justice. The universe that we observe has precisely the properties we should expect if there is, at bottom, no design, no purpose, no evil, no good, nothing but pitiless indifference." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Brendan Behan
item.description: "Critics are like eunuchs in a harem; they know how it's done, they've seen it done every day, but they're unable to do it themselves." -- Brendan Behan

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Piers Anthony
item.description: "I think it's a shame that something as creative and vital to the nature of the human species as story-telling is largely controlled by the soulless cretins known as publishers." -- Piers Anthony

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "The most terrifying words in the English language are: I'm from the government and I'm here to help." -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Christie Golden
item.description: "We all are weak, in one way or another. It does not matter the species. Some times that weakness is a strength in dusguise. Sometimes it is our utter undoing. Some times it is both. A wise man seeks to find a lesson from it. A fool lets it control and destroy him. And sometimes the wise man is the fool." -- Christie Golden

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Christie Golden
item.description: "Ner'zhul... Gul'dan. Two of the darkest names ever to sully the history of my people. And yet, Drek'thar tells me that once Ner'zhul was admired, even beloved, and truly cared for the people whos spiritual leader he was. It is hard to reconcile those words with what Ner'zhul has become, but I try. I try because I want to understand. And yet, try as I might... I do not." -- Christie Golden

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Richard A. Knaak
item.description: "It is as if we are trapped in a never-ending game, our lives hinging on the roll of a dice or the turn of a card. " -- Richard A. Knaak

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Jeff Lindsay
item.description: "Mutilated corpses with a chance of afternoon showers. I got dressed and went to work. " -- Jeff Lindsay

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Maybe they know what I know, that the true way to a man's heart is six inches of metal between his ribs. Sometimes four inches will do the job, but to be really sure, I like to have six." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "If I let you get killed, the other body guards will make fun of me." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "What did they think I was going to do, steal a body? If I wanted to, I could empty the damn place and get every corpse to play follow the leader. Perhaps that was why I needed watching. Perhaps." --Anita Blake" -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Death, especially violent death, will turn the meanest bastard in the world into a nice guy. Why is that?" -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "Should I eat first or accuse the Master of the City of murder? Choices, choices. -Anita" -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "He was twenty. I remembered twenty. I'd known everything at twenty. It took me another year to realize I knew nothing. I was still hoping to learn something before I hit thirty, but I wasn't holding my breath." -- Laurell K. Hamilton

item.title: Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
Bradley add a quote by Laurell K. Hamilton
item.description: "One thing I've learned about vampires--they keep pulling new rabbits out of their cloaks. Big, fanged, carnivorous bunnies that'll eat your eyeballs if you're not paying attention." -- Laurell K. Hamilton
